unit.title: Reading for Meaning I: Stories that Teach
unit.overview: Learners practise strategic reading with short Ghanaian narratives and informational texts. They identify main ideas, supporting details, context clues, and inferences; then connect lessons to daily life and Christian/Ghanaian moral values. Designed as micro-lessons with built-in XP and AI tasks to reduce fatigue.
competencies: Identify main idea and key details in short texts (fiction and non-fiction).
Use context clues (definition, example, contrast) to find word meanings.
Make inferences about characters’ feelings and motives using text evidence.
Summarise a paragraph in one or two clear sentences.
Explain a theme or moral and relate it to personal experience.
values_morals: Honesty, hospitality, diligence, and respect for elders.
Proverbs as wisdom literature guiding behaviour (e.g., Proverbs 22:1).

lessons.title: Reading Strategy: Main Idea & Details
objectives: Distinguish between main idea and supporting details.
Use headings and topic sentences to predict content.

vocabulary.definition: What the text is mostly about.
Evidence or examples that explain the main idea.
Say what you think will happen or what a text will discuss.

lessons.moral_link: Pay attention to the most important message before reacting.

content_blocks.body: Skim headings and first sentences; ask: What is this mostly about? Then verify with key details.
Underline the topic sentence; circle two details that support it.

options: What the text is mostly about

ai_task.prompt: Read a short paragraph (provided in the next lesson) and write one sentence that states the main idea.

lessons.title: Folktale: The Honest Calabash
objectives: Identify main idea, key details, and theme in a short Ghanaian folktale.
Infer character traits using evidence from dialogue and actions.

vocabulary.definition: A container made from a dried gourd.
A traditional story passed down by a community.

lessons.moral_link: A good name is better than riches (Proverbs 22:1).

content_blocks.title: The Honest Calabash
content_blocks.body:
In a village near Hohoe, Kojo carved calabashes with careful hands. One market day, a trader dropped her
purse. Kojo found it beside his stall. He asked around, but no one claimed it. Some urged him to keep the
money, saying, 'Times are hard.' Kojo shook his head. He placed the purse inside a calabash and hung it where
all could see. At sunset the trader returned, eyes worried. Kojo brought down the calabash and returned the
purse. She opened it and smiled with relief. The next week, customers crowded Kojo’s stall, saying, 'We trust
the hands that carved these.' Kojo’s business grew—not because he kept the money, but because he kept his
name.

comprehension.q: What is the main idea of the story?
options: Honesty builds trust and brings lasting reward.
The trader lost her way home.

comprehension.q: Which detail best supports the main idea?
options: Kojo carved calabashes with careful hands.
Kojo put the purse where all could see and returned it.
The trader visited the market at sunset.

comprehension.q: What can we infer about Kojo?
options: He values integrity over quick money.

theme_prompt.prompt: State the theme of the folktale in one sentence. Connect it to a real-life situation at school or home.

lessons.title: Context Clues: Unlocking Word Meaning
objectives: Use definition, example, and contrast clues to guess meanings.
Confirm guesses with a dictionary (digital or print).

vocabulary.definition: A hint in the sentence that helps you understand a word.
A difference between two or more things.
A direct explanation of a word’s meaning.

lessons.moral_link: Seek understanding first; do not pretend to know.

content_blocks.body: Types: definition (is/means), example (such as/for example), contrast (but/unlike).

‘Kojo was tempted, but unlike some traders, he refused to keep the purse.’ — The clue type is:

ai_task.prompt: From the folktale, choose one difficult word and write your own sentence using a context clue to show its meaning.

lessons.title: Informational Text: Cocoa in Ghana
objectives: Identify main idea and supporting details in non-fiction.

vocabulary.definition: A good sold to another country.
Able to continue without harming resources.

lessons.moral_link: Diligence and fairness in work bless the community.

content_blocks.title: Cocoa in Ghana
content_blocks.body:
Cocoa is one of Ghana’s most important cash crops. Many families depend on cocoa cultivation for income.
Farmers plant seedlings under shade trees and carefully protect them from pests. When pods ripen, the beans
are fermented and dried. Ghana exports cocoa to many countries, where it becomes chocolate and other products.
Programmes that teach sustainable farming help farmers increase quality while protecting the land.

comprehension.q: What is the main idea of the paragraph?
options: Ghanaian farmers prefer oranges to cocoa.
Cocoa is important to Ghana and requires careful cultivation and export.
Pests are the only challenge farmers face.
Cocoa becomes chocolate in other countries.

summary_task.prompt: Write a 1–2 sentence summary of the paragraph. Avoid examples and minor details.

lessons.title: Putting It Together: Theme, Summary, and Presentation
objectives: Explain how details support the main idea across texts.
Prepare a brief oral presentation connecting a theme to personal life.

vocabulary.definition: The big idea or message of a text.
Specific detail from a text that supports a point.

lessons.moral_link: Let your words reflect your values; speak truth with humility.

content_blocks.body: A strong theme statement + two pieces of evidence + a link to real life make a clear presentation.

ai_task.prompt: Write a theme statement for either the folktale or the cocoa text. Add two evidence points.

speaking_task.prompt: Record a 30–40 second presentation explaining the theme and how it applies to school life.

quiz_mcq.q: The main idea of a text is:
options: What the text is mostly about

quiz_mcq.q: Which sentence best states the theme of 'The Honest Calabash'?
options: Honesty earns trust and lasting reward.

quiz_mcq.q: ‘Unlike some traders, Kojo refused to keep the purse.’ This is an example of a:

options: State the main idea and the most important points.

quiz_mcq.q: Which is the best piece of evidence for the theme of integrity?
options: Kojo hung the purse for all to see and returned it.
Hints in the text that help you understand a word.
Captions at the bottom of a page.

quiz_mcq.q: Which transition best links evidence to a theme?
In non-fiction, supporting details often include:

options: Kojo values honesty more than money.

quiz_mcq.q: A theme best described as ‘hospitality’ would be supported by evidence that characters:
options: Welcome guests kindly and provide help.

writing_prompt.prompt: Choose either the folktale or the cocoa text. Write a 3–4 sentence summary that includes the main idea and two key details.

speaking_task.prompt: Give a 30-second oral summary of one text and explain one lesson you will apply at school or home.

criteria.name: Clarity & Concision
criteria.descriptor: Uses precise language; stays within length.

criteria.name: Evidence Use
criteria.descriptor: Cites text details to support points.
